words.description: A building for human habitation, especially one that is lived in by a family or small group of people.
A domesticated carnivorous mammal that typically has a long snout.
A small domesticated carnivorous mammal with soft fur.
Feel a deep romantic or sexual attachment to someone.
Put food into the mouth, chew, and swallow it.
Take liquid into the mouth and swallow.
Feeling or showing pleasure or contentment.
Feeling or showing sorrow; unhappy.
Of considerable or relatively great size, extent, or capacity.
Of a size that is less than normal or usual.
A colorless, transparent, odorless liquid that forms the seas, lakes, rivers, and rain and is the basis of the fluids of living organisms.
Food made of flour, water, and yeast or another leavening agent, mixed together and baked.
An opaque white fluid rich in fat and protein, secreted by female mammals for the nourishment of their young.
The star around which the earth orbits.
The natural satellite of the earth, visible (chiefly at night) by reflected light from the sun.
A period of twenty-four hours as a unit of time, reckoned from one midnight to the next, corresponding to a rotation of the earth on its axis.
The period of darkness in each twenty-four hours; the time from sunset to sunrise.
Of the color between green and orange in the spectrum, a primary subtractive color complementary to blue; colored like ripe lemons or egg yolks.
Of the color between blue and yellow in the spectrum; colored like grass or emeralds.
Of a color at the end of the spectrum next to orange and opposite violet.
Of a color intermediate between green and violet, as of the sky or sea on a sunny day.
Of the color of milk or fresh snow, due to the reflection of most wavelengths of visible light; the opposite of black.
Of the very darkest color owing to the absence of or complete absorption of light; the opposite of white.
A visible mass of condensed water vapor floating in the atmosphere, typically high above the ground.
Moisture condensed from the atmosphere that falls visibly in separate drops.
Atmospheric water vapor frozen into ice crystals and falling in light white flakes or lying on the ground as a white layer.
The region of the atmosphere and outer space seen from the earth.
The third planet from the sun; the planet on which we live.
The invisible gaseous substance surrounding the earth, a mixture mainly of oxygen and nitrogen.
Combustion or burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and typically give out bright light, heat, and smoke.
A piece of furniture with a flat top and one or more legs, providing a level surface on which objects may be placed.
A separate seat for one person, typically with a back and four legs.
A movable barrier used to open and close an entrance.
An opening in the wall or roof of a building or vehicle that is fitted with glass or other transparent material.
A written or printed work consisting of pages glued or sewn together along one side and bound in covers.
Material manufactured in thin sheets from the pulp of wood or other fibrous substances, used for writing, drawing, or printing on, or as wrapping material.
A bird's feather used as an ornament or for writing with ink.
An instrument for writing or drawing, consisting of a thin stick of graphite or a similar substance enclosed in a long thin piece of wood or fixed in a metal or plastic case.
A large town.
A small town or village.
A nation with its own government, occupying a particular territory.
A person whom one knows and with whom one has a bond of mutual affection.
A group consisting of two parents and their children living together as a unit.
A woman in relation to a child or children to whom she has given birth.
A man in relation to his child or children.
A boy or man in relation to either or both of his parents.
A girl or woman in relation to either or both of her parents.
A son of the same parents as another person; a male sibling.
A daughter of the same parents as another person; a female sibling.
An institution for educating children.
A person who teaches others, especially in a school.
A young human being below the age of puberty or below the legal age of majority.
A female child.
Engage in activity for enjoyment and recreation rather than a serious or practical purpose.
Move at a speed faster than a walk, never having both or all the feet on the ground at the same time.
Move suddenly and quickly in a specified direction.
Propel oneself through water using the limbs.
Be in a state of sleep.
Stop sleeping; become awake.
Obtain in exchange for payment.
Give something to someone else in exchange for money.
Move or travel toward or into a place.
Move from one place to another; travel.
Exist; be present.
Exist; have the quality of being.
Use language in order to express thoughts, feelings, or ideas.
Give one's attention to a sound.
Perceive with the eyes.
Direct one's gaze in a specified direction.
Look at and comprehend the meaning of written or printed matter by interpreting the characters or symbols of which it is composed.
Mark (letters, words, or other symbols) on a surface, typically paper, with a pen, pencil, or similar implement.
Gain or acquire knowledge of or skill in (something) by study, experience, or being taught.
Show or explain to (someone) how to do something.
Engage in activity involving mental or physical effort done in order to achieve a purpose or result.
Cease work or movement in order to relax, refresh oneself, or recover strength.
Move at a speed faster than a walk, never having both or all the feet on the ground at the same time.
Move suddenly and quickly in a specified direction.
Propel oneself through water using the limbs.
Engage in activity for enjoyment and recreation rather than a serious or practical purpose.
